You scramble up and make it through the screen door and back inside. Mortified, you find a full length mirror and look at yourself. The hot pink boyshort bikini exposing nearly your entire body, the stylish incredibly feminine hairdo! This is NOT how you wanted to be introduced to the neighbours.

Still, maybe you could salvage this. Didn't he refer to you as "miss"? He couldn't have gotten a clear view of you. He was a bit far away when he saw you, and you look so different from normal, that if you just get back to a masculine appearance he mightn't recognise you. Just pretend the person he saw at the pool was your... sister? Cousin? Whatever. Someone who's only briefly staying anyway.

But first you need to get back to normal and introduce yourself to the neighbour as the man you are.
153111.title: Somebody was watching

choices: It's your neighbour, calling to apologise
It's your neighbour, just leaving a note
1531111.content:
"EDNA, get this stuff off."

"Affirmative."

Mechanical arms reach out and remove the padded bikini top and bikini shorts, thought the hairdo remains intact.

Okay, you think, it actually seems to be working. Maybe this isn't so bad after all. Of course you're stark naked, but progress.

As you look in the mirror, you notice surprisingly strong tan, which unfortunately is accented by surprisingly strong bikini tan lines. You could probably get away with the bottoms since the tan lines were like a mix between shorts and underpants, but the upper body.... yeah, two connected white shapes over your chest with white lines leading from them up to your neck... there's no way they could be seen as anything other than the result of sunbathing with a bikini.

"I've got to find a way to cover this up," you say to yourself.

"Affirmative." announces EDNA.

"Wait!" But arms come out again and quickly wrap a dressing gown around you, neatly tying the fabric belt with a bow off to one side.

Huh, that was actually good. Maybe you were distrusting EDNA too much. Understandable since this was all so new. The gown was slate grey, soft and silky, though maybe slightly feminine. You were noticing how it seemed to end just above the knees when you were shocked to hear a noise by the front door.
1531111.title: Unwisely leave this task to EDNA

choices: Forget about it for now, enjoy the rest of the evening
15311112.content:
You freeze, you hear a rustle through the letterbox, faintly hear footsteps going away, and wait until it sounds quiet.

The front door does have windows, but they're privacy glass thankfully so you're not worried as you glance through them to ensure no one's outside. Under the letterbox, you find a handwritten note.


Neighbourly greetings!

My name is Frank Earnest, the guy living one number down from you.

First up, I want to apologise for today. I know I may have seemed like a voyeur, but I can assure you, I only saw you a few times when you were sunbathing as I was out in the garden, and when I heard that you seemed to have hurt yourself, I was just trying to make sure you're okay. The fence is a lot shorter on my side then it is on yours, so it's not hard to look into your garden. If you're worried about this, we can talk about raising the fence or growing bushes or something. As they say, Good fences make good neighbours!

So I'm sorry this is how we made our introduction. I'd really like to make it up to you, maybe get something to eat or one of us could drop by the other's house.

I'm sure once we talk you'll get to know me you'll know I'm much better than your first impression of me. I really do spend my time doing things other than spying on attractive ladies at swimming pools!

If you wanna get in contact, my number's below

Welcome to the neighbourhood!
Frank


You sigh. "Attractive ladies"? You get knot in your stomach about how he clearly mistook you for one. At least you're now sure that he didn't think you were a guy in a bikini, the distance and EDNA doing the job so well contributed to that. So with that small benefit, you needed a way to set him straight (*haha*) on the matter. Somehow informing him know that his real new neighbour isn't an attractive lady, and explain how the woman he saw had every reason to be there yet he'd never be seeing ever again.
15311112.title: It's your neighbour, just leaving a note

choices: Having a nice long relaxing bath
Out for a night on the town
153111122.content:
You decide to nip this one in the bud. You look around for your mobile phone and realise you can't find it, it had been in your pants which you'd taken off in the locker room, but looking in there you can't see any sign of it or your pants. Damn, you'd need to ask EDNA later about getting the phone back, but one thing at a time. You decide to pick up one of the house phones and pick one up and dial the number on the note.

"Hello," a clear voice answers, similar to the one you'd heard by the pool.

"Hello, this is John, I assume I'm talking to Frank."

"Yes?"

"Well, this is awkward, I'm the cousin of the woman you saw by the pool."

"Oh... oh, I'm sorry. I just left a note there..."

"Yes, I know, listen it's okay. She was just a little surprised that's all. She understands you didn't mean any harm, apology accepted."

"Oh, I'm glad to hear that. She's not too unsettled or anything?"

"No, she's fine, in fact she's..."
153111122.title: Contact him with an explanation

choices: Somehow, trying to explain makes everything worse
1531111221.content:
"...just having a bath right now. Lots of suds and everything. I can hear her right now. She's having a great time."

"Ah, well I hope I you aren't calling out to her just because of me?"

"What?" It takes you a moment to process what he's talking about. He seems to still think your "cousin" is the owner of this house, that you're just visiting her. "No, no nothing like that," you splutter.

"Oh good to hear. It's good of you to help your cousin move in, I think I saw you move her boxes. Were you close growing up?"

"I... yes, we visited eachother a lot...." Damn, you had to steer this back to what you wanted to say...

"What's her name by the way?"

"I... oh it's...." you stumble, "Jane."

"John and Jane?"

"Yeah we um, we had a lot people making fun of us back then, you know how kids are."

"I knew a Jane once, one of the nicest people I ever met."

"Oh, really..."

"Yeah, went scuba diving with her once, you ever been? Or Jane?"

"Erm, no...."

"Well, I'll leave you to it, give my regards to Jane, glad she understands, and wish her the best from me in her new house."

"Wait, actually that's the thing...."

"Sorry?"
1531111221.title: Having a nice long relaxing bath

choices: Laze around and head to bed
15311112212.content:
"She doesn't actually live in this house, I do."

"What?"

"I moved in, she's only briefly staying here, and she plans to move out."

"Oh, why is she staying?"

"Well... times are tight for her, she just needed a place to crash while she looks for a job."

"Well if she wants a job, she can work for me!"

"...wha?" You stare, open mouthed.

"I own lumber company downtown. We're hiring new assistants."

"Well, I think she's got a good opportunity, I mean we're so close I'm not sure if... experience mightn't be...."

"Look, just tell her: 9:30am, tomorrow morning. Sit an interview, we'll see what happens."

"She's not going to be ready. I don't think..."

"Look, if she doesn't show up, that's her decision. I can make time for her if she does, and if she doesn't I've other stuff I can do."

You breath a bit easier, "Well, I guess I can tell her."

"Okay, got the time?"

"9:30am tomorrow," and then you read out the address he gives you.

"Glad that's settled, talk soon." And he hangs up.

How did that happen? It started with a neighbourly exchange and it ended up with a job interview for someone who's not going to show up.

You had enough of this, it was late and you just wanted to wrap up this weird day.
15311112212.title: Somehow, trying to explain makes everything worse

choices: The bath program completes as programmed
Something starts to go horribly wrong
153111122121.content:
You catch another glimpse of yourself in the mirror. The gown briefly looked a bit alluring, and you still had to do something about that hairstyle, but you couldn't help but notice you seemed slightly bronzed. That sun must have been something today.

The reflection puts you in mind of your fictional cousin, "You know, a big bath wouldn't actually be a bad idea right now."

"Confirmed. Your bath is ready for you upstairs!" EDNA's voice called out.

"Already?" You walked up, and sure enough a hot, bubbly bath was already there for you. Strange, did EDNA overhear what you'd said on the phone?

Either way, you take off the gown and gradually sink into the hot warm bubbles. The social awkwardness mixed with intense relaxation made this a strange day, but for now relaxing more seemed like the idea. Deep breaths of the strong herbal smells definitely help this.

Then, you feel something in your head, robotic arms have once again come out from the walls and are now gently massaging your head, they even seem to be undoing your hairstyle. Oh this is the greatest, you think you don't even need to worry about undoing your hairstyle, the house is doing it for you. A sudden stream of bubbles come up from the bath bottom and you let yourself drift away. This was so easy, so effortless.

"EDNA, after this just bring me to bed, I don't want to worry about anything else for a while."

"Confirmed"

And the bubbles streamed out more, buffetting your body and massaging it in the most relaxing way.

As you rested, more arms came out. They washed your hair, cleaned you, wiped your face with a cloth, and even massaged you with various handheld massagers. It was heavy, like having an army of servants anticipate your every need.
153111122121.title: Laze around and head to bed

1531111221211.content:
You start to drift in and out, mind wandering. The house seems to do more body and face massages that are gentle, and eventually, just before you are likely to get tired of it, you hear the plug go and the water drains out.

You lie in the bath while this happens, but a gush of warm air suddenly blows down on you, keeping you warm where normally you'd get cold as your wet skin was exposed to the air.

The arms lift you up, wrap your hair and body in towels which they rub to dry you, give you some water to drink and whisk you away to the bedroom. The towels are removed but before you can take a step you are dressed in a set of luxurious pure silk red pyjamas that cover you from your ankles to your wrists. Then you're lifted into bed and tucked in.

This is perfect.

As half asleep mind drifts even further asleep, you hear EDNA ask "Confirm appointment for tomorrow."

"Yeah, just take care of it." You blurt out, and with that your last shred of consciousness leaves you.
1531111221211.title: The bath program completes as programmed

15311112212112.content:
Early the next morning, you hear a soft alarm chime. "It is time to wake up," EDNA announces.

"Urrrgh, snooze, sleep, let me sleep more," you mumble, as you turn over.

"Would you like to sleep through morning routine?" EDNA's voice replies back.

"Sure, whatever."

"Initiating Sonabulent Starting Routine."

EDNA monitors you as you fall back to sleep, soon you're sleeping deeply again, an she gets to work.

Gently, a set of padded arms come out and move you, like a conveor belt, back to the bathroom. A set of warm wet sponges, wipe you down and clean your body, moisturising lotion is applied just like the sun tan lotion the previous day. You're so deep in sleep, you feel the unusual sensations, but not enough to stir you.

Then a set of incredibly sharp razors come out, and shave you swiftly and painlessly, your legs, arms, chest, and face now smooth. Toothbrushes come out and brush your teeth, you're moved to the bath and warm water mixed with shampoo and conditional flow into your head, is kneaded by robotic fingers, and then rinsed out again.

Another gust of warm air dries you, and then it begins in earnest....
15311112212112.title: Next morning.

153111122121121.content:
You've been having a strange mix of dreams, so it becomes hard to tell fantasy from reality, but as you stir, you feel a sense of traffic passing and your body in motion in a way that seems strange but too unusual to be purely made up.

Flicking your eyes open, you look through a car window to see a car pass in the other direction. You instinctively reach towards the window and freeze, your hand has perfectly manicured ruby red nails. Also a very nice (diamond?) ring on your middle finger. Startled, you look down and your view is partially blocked by two big mounds coming out of your chest, covered by a white blouse. Over that is a smart black business jacket that opens up to almost show off your chest, and beyond that you see two sleek nyloned legs coming out of a tight black skirt. Draped over your shoulder is a fashionable black purse.

Your heart jumps! This is what you're like? In public?

You lean forward to get a look at yourself in the rear view mirror, but somehow this just attracts the driver's attention.

"Ah, glad you had a good rest."

You gulp and just nod. Hopefully he was okay with a weirdly dressed guy in his car.

"I wouldn't be that rested before a job interview I can tell you."

"Job interview?" you squeak, your voice sounds different, but you assume it's just because of the surprise.

"Yep, don't worry, you'll be in plenty of time. And dressed like that you've nothing to worry about."

You're heart jumps again, but he didn't seem to have used the statement maliciously...

You have a thought and open the purse. There's a big makeup bag in it but you just take out the compact and look at yourself in its small mirror. You open your mouth in surprise.

Ebony flowing hair framed a sumptuous feminine face. Deep red lips, dark shaded eyelids, long mascara eyelashes, delicately soft face. This was someone you'd like to ask out to a date, not to be!

Straining, you try to figure out what happened to your face. A lot of foundation, blush, and other makeup mixed with the hairstyle and all the clothing combined in a hard to escape illusion. The taxi driver wasn't upset about driving a weridly dressed guy, because he thought it was a formally dressed girl. More to the point, what happened?
153111122121121.title: You awake in a taxi

1531111221211211.content:
"We're here," the driver announces.

You look up to vaguely see a building. You're not sure what to do.

"Listen, if you need me to pick you up afterwards," he gives you a smile, "I can take you any place you need. There's a bar near here if you want to blow off some steam, I go there a lot myself"

Is he hitting on you? You shake your head get out of the car, and instantly stumble on your high heels, black, pump and 4 inches. You try to regain your balance and suddenly wonder if you can even walk anywhere in these, but before you can turn, the taxi drives off, its driver giving you a wave and a smile.

Aou stand there in front of an office building with its steps up the the entrance and its glass doors. The doors reflect a hesitant young woman, with looks that could kill, standing in formal dress with skirt, tights and high heels, clutching her purse.... and that woman is you.

How did you end up in this situation? You start to finally remember enough about the previous day, something about a job interview at 9:30am at your neighbours office. You look at your wrist and see a smart silver ladies watch with the time at 9:10am. Somehow, you're on time for a job interview you didn't even try to get to!

You look around and decide to...
1531111221211211.title: We're here

choices: A beeping comes from your purse
15311112212112112.content:
You can't deal with this right, now, you stumble down the street away from the office. You can't believe how hard walking in heels is, like walking a tightrope, you put all your concentration into walking in them but quickly decide you need a break and duck into a fashionable cafe.

You take a seat look up, and once again are startled. There, the next table over, is Frank. Dressed in a white shirt and black trousers, he's chatting to a few others, and before you can look away he glances in your direction.

He looks at you, face frozen for a sec, you're face probably showing a deer in headlights expression, then he nods and looks back to his fellow workmates. You exhale and realise... he's only ever seen you from a distance, he probably doesn't know what you look like.

With relief, you think of ordering a coffee, probably with a lot of sugar when.
15311112212112112.title: Walk away

153111122121121121.content:
You suddenly hear a strangely familiar chime, you think its someone else’s but you gradually realise its coming from your purse and open it. Inside is a nice sleek smarphone that doesn't look like a model you know (but then all smartphones kinda look the same). Before you can even reach for a button, the chime stops and suddenly EDNA's loud voice comes through.

"Your job interview will start in 15 mins."

"What? No..." you try to shush the phone.

"The office is 100m away. Move to it now to ensure you will be arrive more than the recommended 10 mins before the job interview."

"Okay, I got it, thank you."

"You're welcome Jane," and it stopped.

"Wait, you're Jane?" Franks voice directed right at you now.

"I.... um... look I wasn't sure whether..."

"Haha, great coincidence. Excuse me lads... C'mon Jane, I'll take you to the office."

Before you can say much, he's got his hand over the small of your back and guiding you to the office.

Your high heels clack through down the pavement, the steps provide a challenge and you feel Frank hold you as he guides you up them, he opens the door for you which you accept, and with a nod to the receptionist he guides you to the elevator and takes you up 7 stories.

You're not sure what to do. Why not walk away? But Frank exudes a calmness and clarity of purpose that it feels that any other option would be huge uncertainty. Maybe you could just bomb the job interview and be done with it. Finally he takes you to his office, opens the door and guides you through.
153111122121121121.title: A beeping comes from your purse

1531111221211211211.content:
You're there, pronounced breasts that you haven’t yet been able to figure out, flowing black hair, a smart formal dress that shows off plenty of leg, heels that already make you adopt a somewhat sultry pose and you're standing in front of a man who want to give you an interview that will determine whether you will have to present yourself just like this for 5 days a week on a continual basis.

You take a second to moisten your lips. Whatever his first question is, you'll have to answer it carefully.

"Well I'm glad to have you on board Jane! Your first job is to take these documents to Teller," he hands you a big folder with a sticky note 'FAO: Raymond Teller', "He he's on the 3rd floor. After that, talk to my secretary just outside, and she'll tell you what's next." He then walks straight to the door, giving you a pat on the shoulder, then leaves.

Your standing there, folder of documents in your hand, and your purse still slung over your shoulder, and you've suddenly got a job. How did this happen?
1531111221211211211.title: Option 1

15311112212112112111.content:
You felt a rush of anxiety as you were standing there, smartly dressed as a woman, in an office, with a stack of papers to deliver to someone. The panic swelled. You had to get out of there!

You nervously began walking towards the elevator when a woman approached you. "Excuse me. Can I help you?"

You stared vacantly at her, mouth slightly agape, unsure what to say or tell her.

"Oh! You must be the new girl, Jane, isn't it? I'm Wendy, Frank's assistant here."

She glanced at the stack of papers. "Ray Teller, huh? Let me guess, Frank hired you, gave you some vague instructions, and sent you on your way? Yeah, he's like that. Good boss, but a little vague on the concept of getting new people settled.

"Tell you what, I'll get you to Ray, introduce you around, and then we'll head to HR to get you all signed on

"Oh, and watch out for Ray. He thinks of himself as quite the ladies man. But I'm sure you've had to deal with guys like him before. C'mon."

And with that, Wendy pushed the button on the elevator and the doors immediately opened. You cursed your luck as she guided you into the elevator.

"Well have to swing by a desk so you can put your things down and start settling in. Welcome aboard, Jane," Wendy said, smiling, and the elevator doors slid shut.
15311112212112112111.title: The Working Day

153111122121121121111.content:
Your stomach sank along with the elevator. Wendy seemed very nice, maybe just explain to her the situation... leaving a few details out?

"I'm not sure about working here..." you start, practically gulping your words as you have trouble putting them out.

"Oh don't worry," she puts her hand on your shoulder in a intended comforting gesture that takes you by surprise. "Big offices like this can be intimating, but I'm sure after a few days you'll be walking around like you live here." You gulp at the thought. "Look, I'll just take you to Ray's office, you deliver the documents and we'll take it from there, one step at a time." You nod and the elevator door opens.

The scene is of rows of cubicles walled by offices at the sides. A few office workers look up, and immediately you feel self conscious, pressing the documents against your well endowed chest. There are smiles and nods.

"It's okay," said Wendy, she takes your hand and you stumble forward as she guides you through a row of cubicles. You see more heads turn, more male faces look at you, smiles as they nod in your direction, you can barely handle it.

"Wendy, what's the situation with the Haddington Contract?" A voice from a cubicle worker you just passed asks.

"Oh goodness knows," Wendy turns around to face the guy, "they've changed their mind six times already and keep asking us the same questions."

"It's just they've sent another email and this time...." he pauses, noticing you, your eyes lock. "Have we met?" The question tingles your mind, does the guy look familar? Do you know him? Does he recognise you? Like this?

"This is Jane, our new assistant. Jane, this is Pete, he does accounts."

"Pleasure to meet you," he says leaning forward, hand outstretched. You shuffle the documents around to free up your right hand. As you reach out to shake, your purse slides from your shoulder down your arm, so you're awkwardly shaking his hand as your purse hangs from your wrist. You grimace in embarrassment, scared to say anything, but Pete just smiles. "If you need anything, despotically with the 9th division, just let me know" You smile and nod, more determined to get out of here before you ever have the opportunity to learn what the 9th division is.

As you pull the purse back onto your shoulder Wendy turns to you.

"I just need to talk to Pete about this contract. Ray's office is just over there, corner office, can't miss it. He's probably out, so just drop the documents on his desk and meet back with me here." You leave the pair and head in the direction of the corner office. On the way you see a door marked "Fire Escape". Tempting, but you realise that the door may be alarmed, and even if it isn't you'd have to navigate what would probably be concrete steps while wearing heels. The soft beige carpet is already proving trouble as your heels tend to sink into the fabric requiring more concentration.

You look forward again to see a door marked "Raymond Teller" that's partially open, you knock on it quickly and push your way in, only to find a middle aged, yet decently looking man with neat black hair, staring right back of you as you enter the room.
153111122121121121111.title: Meeting Raymond

1531111221211211211111.content:
"Oh, I wasn't expecting to see such a beautiful face this early in the morning," he replied, as he stood by his desk, in the middle of adjusting his tie.

This time the panic really hits your stomach. Your stomach gives a lurch, bringing acid up to your mouth. With your lips tightly closed in a smile of panic, you swallow it back down, clearing your mouth but leaving you with a burning throat.

You hope he hasn't noticed this, if he noticed the gulp, hey may have misinterpreted it. "I'm Raymond Teller, but everyone calls me Ray. I'd have remembered such a pretty face so I assume you're new?"

You nod.

"And your name is?"

"Jane," you blurt out, with everything going on with your throat and your nerves, the reply comes out as high pitched. This isn't helped when you realise this is the first time you've actively supported the lie.

"Jane, that's a lovely name. What bring a lovely person like you working here?"

"Well, it's complicated," you just about squeeze out.

"Ah, I understand."

There's a moment of silence, the two of you standing there, and you realise you still have to step towards him and give him the documents. Once delivered, you'd have no reason to stay.

You take an unsteady step forward, then another. Ray holds eye contact, you look down and put the documents onto the desk. Before you can look up again, you feel a hand on your shoulder. You give an involuntary start.

"It's okay, we don't bite. You're just a bit nervous about first day at work right? Whole new environment? Not sure about anything?"

You nod a bit more enthusiastically then you probably should, he is right after all.

"Here, have a seat, you could do with a rest." He gently pushes down on your shoulder, and with the exhaustion and tensions about everything, you go along with it and collapse into a comfortable chair. You realise it's isn't the strongest position to be in, but you'll take any rest you can.

"I remember my first day working here, I wasn't as stunning as you, but I had my own challenges. But you don't want to hear about that, you want to hear about something that can help you in the here and now, and think I have just the thing for that..."

He opens a cabinet, takes out a decanter along with two small glasses that he sets on the desk, and fills them with a golden liquid. You stare wide eyed.

"You seem like a girl who could use a drink!"
1531111221211211211111.title: Teller doesn't waste any time

choices: You want to change clothes, EDNA misunderstands
You realize EDNA isn't going to help much.
15311112212112112111112.content:
You stared at Teller for a few moments. Mouth agape.

"Well, Jane? Would you like a drink now" He asked again.

"I... uh..." you squeaked out, finally coming to your senses. "No thank you. Not at work." The absolute last thing you needed was alcohol and trying to manage these stupid shoes EDNA had gotten you into.

Raymond smiled. "Great. We'll grab drinks after work, to celebrate your first day."

"Wait... I..." you started to explain when there was a knock on Teller's doorframe. You turned to see Wendy smiling at you.

"If you're done with Jane, Ray, I need to get her settled in."

"Right. Sorry, we were having such a pleasant conversation. Se you later then, Jane. I'm looking forward to it." He helped you out of the chair and walked you, with his hand in the small of your back, over to Wendy. "She's all yours,"

You slowly walked out of Teller's office, confused at how dropping off some files turned into essentially a date over drinks with another guy.

This had to end. Now. You needed some time to collect your thoughts and figure out what to do before you got into any more trouble here. You needed just a few minutes, alone.

"Uh... can I use the restroom?" You squeaked out to Wendy.

"Oh, sure. First day nerves, huh?" Wendy winked at you. "The ladies room is right over here."

She led you to the door with the "female" icon on it. You felt creepy, going in there, but as you were dressed, she really gave you little choice.

You opened the door and slowly walked into the bathroom. After a quick scan, you allowed yourself a quick exhale when you realized you were alone. You quickly minced into a stall, sat down, and locked the door to the stall.

Tearing open your purse, you grabbed that phone. Maybe you could get a cab, an Uber.... something to get you out of here. Maybe you could play like you're sick?

You activated the phone. There was a beep, and EDNA's voice came out. "Hello Jane. Would you like to make a call, or was there something else I could do for you?"

"EDNA! I need to get out of here!" you yell whispered into the phone.

"Is the interview that you had scheduled not going well?" The voice asked.

"What? No! It went a little too well! I wound up hired here!" You told EDNA.

"Employment noted. Work location saved. Congratulations, Jane." EDNA told you.

"This is no cause for congratulations, EDNA! People here think I'm a woman and a big shot here asked me out on a date for dunks this evening!"

"Date with Executive noted," EDNA said. "Is this casual or will you require a change of clothes?"
15311112212112112111112.title: Reject

153111122121121121111121.content:
"What?" you look at yourself, "what I'm wearing is hardly casual."

"Understood, date clothing selected. Clothing change will be initiated on your return home."

"What? No, cancel that."

"Understood, searching for places to change clothing near your location..."

"No, I don't want that either."

"Understood, clothing will be delivered to your place of work."

"WHAT?"

Your yell suddenly pains your throat and you cough in pain. Your throat raw, especially after that incident in Raymond's office.

"Damn, last thing I need is to lose my voice."

"Throat lozenges can be found in your purse," EDNA announces. You blink, something helpful at least. You root around your purse, and finding the lozenges, take two and roll them around in your mouth. It's sweet flavour and juices soothe your throat, and with one thing right you decide to make one more shot speaking sense into EDNA.

"EDNA, I 'eed to get ou' of 'ere," you say with the lozenges still in your mouth.

"I'm glad you're enjoying yourself there."

"No, I 'an' a 'axi."

"I have no Ex's on record, would you like to add one?"

You clearly didn't think far ahead on this one. Alright, you could spit out the lozenges and then....

The bathroom door opens. Wendy? No, you hear two pairs of heels, chatting as they approach the sinks. "...not saying Jospeh is always like that but there are times, like at the barbeque event, where I know we all had a bit to drink, but he had a bit TOO much? I know he's having some trouble at home, but we've all got our strains and when was the last time...."

You roll your eyes in exasperation, they sound like they're going to be there a while and no way will you be able to talk sense into EDNA with this conversation in the background.

You leave the stall, wash your hands in pretence, nodding at the two women (one in a very formal business suit, the other more causal), and Wendy greets you outside
153111122121121121111121.title: You want to change clothes, EDNA misunderstands

choices: Here's your company ID.  Welcome aboard!
1531111221211211211111211.content:
Wendy led you down the hallway back to the elevator and pushed the button to call it. "So, what did you think of Ray?" she asked, a bit of a smirk on her face.

You weren't sure how to answer. On the one hand, you had no attraction to him at all. On the other, you didn't want to badmouth anyone. You didn't know what Wendy really thought of Raymond. After an awkward pause, you simply shrugged, brushing a stray lock of hair out of your eye.

Wendy winked. "He sometimes asks women here out for drinks after work."

You took a big swallow of the lozenges' soothing nature, and exhale. You moved the lozenges into your cheek, so as better to enunciate, and tell her, "I know. He asked me out after work today."

Wendy snorted back a laugh. "Did you accept?" Without letting you answer, her eyes widened, The shame of it must have shown on your face. "You did! You have a date with Ray tonight!" She winked and shrugged. " It doesn't matter. You're not really his type. He really likes the spandex mini-dress and stripper heel look, not 'smart business woman'."

EDNA's voice suddenly came from within your purse. "Date outfit noted. Delivery shortly," startling you. You swallowed one of the lozenges, half way, and started coughing. You immediately begin fumbling with your purse, your urgent need to shut EDNA up, coughing at an attempt to get the lozenge back up, combined with your long, lacquered nails made it take what seemed like an eon to do.

When you finally pulled out the phone, you realized that with the women coming into the ladies room, you had forgotten to turn the stupid thing off. You pressed the sleep button on the phone, hoping that things would not get any worse.

"Uh.... what was that?" Wendy asked.

You sighed. You didn't want to get into things with Wendy. You just wanted to get out of here. "Virtual assistant that's not very helpful," you wheezed softly, finally swallowing the lozenge, burning a bit as it went down. You moved the other under your tongue so that it would stay in place and NOT be swallowed.

"Ah," Wendy said. "Virtual assistants never are. That's why we hire women like yourself, Jane."

The elevator doors slid open and you both stepped on. "Lisa in HR is a great woman. She'll help you get settled in here. I'm so glad you accepted the offer! We need all the help around here we can get. We're so short staffed."

You spent several seconds wracking your brain with an excuse to leave, to get out, but before you could think of an excuse, the elevator doors slid open again, and Wendy gestured for you to step out, which you did. Your calves were starting to hurt from the heels on your feet. Wendy led you down a hallway, and knocked on a doorframe. "Lisa? Meet Jane. She's accepted our offer. Call me when you're done with her."

Wendy turned to you, "Welcome aboard, Jane!" and left.

Lisa smiled at you and stood, leaning over her desk to shake your hand. Se reseated herself and began furiously typing on her computer. "I need to find out what position you've been hired into, exactly. The system is a little scant on details. Bear with me a minute. Please, Jane, have a seat," and she gestured at the pair of visitor chairs she had in her office, resuming her typing.

You looked around, hoping that a hole would appear and swallow you up, but the universe seemed to be working against you, and it didn't happen. You sighed and sat down. Thinking quickly, you crossed your legs..
1531111221211211211111211.title: On to HR

choices: The rest of the HR meeting
15311112212112112111112112.content:
You felt the nylon stockings rub together as you crossed your legs, an unfamiliar texture sensation catching you off guard. You're surrounded by a desk, paperwork, file cabinets, in a HR office you'd no business being in. You hoped everything you could just get through this as fast as possible.

"So first of all, do you know what position you've been hired as?"

"Assistant," you say, still managing the lozenge in your mouth.

"Do you know who's assistant?" You shake your head. "Well, we it could be a more general assistant category, I just just need to ensure that...." her words are interrupted by a knock on the door. You look up and your heart skips a beat to see Raymond's leaning in.

"Jane!" he says delighted, "I was just here to talk about you." He looks up to Lisa, "Just checking that my new assistant was getting settled in." HIS assistant? In shock the second lozenge slips down and it gets caught in your throat! Again! You struggle to swallow it.

"Ah so she's your assistant?" Lisa asks.

"Indeed she is, and I can't be happier with her. Any problems setting her up?" he smiles at you. You just try to gulp the lozenge down. Exactly what impression this may leave with him is one you don't want to even imagine.

"Well I wasn't given clear instructions what her role is, but if you're vouching that she's your assistant then that's fine. I'll just register her in the system and get her a desk right outside your office."

"Perfect, great work as always,", then looks to you with a smile "it will be fantastic working with you." You manage to cough the lozenge back into your mouth and clear your throat, but by they time you've done that he's left.

You look back at Lisa, "Okay, Raymond is quite the character. If you have any problems with him... well, worry about that if it happens. In the meantime, you'll be his assistant. Your roles will be running errands, doing paperwork, handling communication, and generally doing whatever he says... within reason. Now lets get you in the system..."
15311112212112112111112112.title: Raymond shows up

choices: It's not legally binding, and I'd rather not cause waves
I'm sorry, I can't sign this.
153111122121121121111121121.content:
You say there, stunned. This creepy guy thought that you... and he was.... no. Just.... no.

Your mind drifted, concerned with how the universe seemed to be conspiring against you. You couldn't believe how far things had gone when Lisa's voice snapped you back to reality.

"Jane? I asked if you understood this," Lisa said, smiling and holding a stack of papers. Most of the pages were folded back, and there was a Post-it flag with a yellow arrow and the words "Sign Here" pointing to line at the bottom of the page.

You looked at the document, then up at Lisa, then down at the paper.

Crap. You were expected to sign something. And it looked legal.

"Jane? Is there a problem with what we've gone over?" Lisa asked, concern rising in her voice.

You looked back down at the page. You weren't sure what you'd be agreeing to. If you were going to have a way out of this mess, this was a golden opportunity. On the other, that may cause issues. If you signed it as Jane, it couldn't be legally binding, could it? So did you sign it, get through the day, and never come back, or just use this as an excuse to get out of here?
153111122121121121111121121.title: The rest of the HR meeting

choices: Your company ID is a phone app, and she asks to to install it on your phone
Skip to end of HR meeting
1531111221211211211111211211.content:
The stack of contract papers looks at you, you pretend to examine them by intently paging through them, stalling.

"Is there anything you want to ask," enquires Lisa.

"Just, erm..... I don't have a pen?"

"Here," she replies and hands you a simple ballpoint. You skip back to the signature page and stare at it.

Lisa spoke up, "Just to repeat: Your salary is competitive. There will be many opportunities as the company plans to expand through various acquisitions, and as the personal assistant to Mr. Teller you're already in a pretty high up position in the company."

You give a tense smile at his name. You don't want to sign this. You didn't want everyone telling you what to do. Everything seemed to be making you do things you didn't want to do! In a burst of anger you put the pen to the signature box and scribbled madly and hard. The paper bent at the pen's impression, you swept the pen back and forth making an incomprehensible network of lines, like something out of little kid's school note book. You barely stopped until the signature area was a huge mess of pen marks and then, defiantly, you handed the contract back to Lisa.

She looked at it a second.

"Okay, then, welcome aboard."

Your lipstick mouth dropped open. The lozenge fell out onto the floor and you didn't even react.

"Slightly unconventional signature," Lisa continued still scrutinising your mark, "but legally binding nonetheless. I think I see a 'J' in there somewhere." You close your mouth in time for her to look up. "With that settled, we get you your company photo ID!"
1531111221211211211111211211.title: It's not legally binding, and I'd rathe...

choices: Raymond shows up instead of Wendy
15311112212112112111112112111.content:
"Perfect," Lisa said with a smile. "Now, we need to get you your employee ID. Do you happen to have a smart phone?"

"Um... I guess," you said, rummaging around in your purse until you found the EDNA connected phone. "You mean like this?"

"Exactly!" Lisa said, beaming. "Uh... is that an iPhone or an Android? You'll need to install an app."

"Install an app?" you repeated. "What for?"

"We use it as an employee ID, key card, etc. It's much more secure," Lisa answered.

"Uh... What app?" you asked, re-awakening the phone.

"It's 'EmployeeID'," Lisa said.

"You want 'EmployeeID' installed on my phone?" you asked.

EDNA's voice immediately piped up. "Installing...." After several moments, EDNA said, "App Installed." You opened the newly installed app and it greeted you with a dialog box asking for a security string. You looked at Lisa, a little confused.

"Great!" Lisa said. "Now I need you to key in the following sequence..." She rambled off a nonsensical string of letters and numbers, which you dutifully typed into the phone. The app chirped, telling you, "Security String Accepted! Welcome aboard, Jane!"

As you looked at the screen, you saw another dialog box overlay the app's, "Employment confirmed... Accessing...." You glared at the phone, shaking it slightly.

"EDNA!" you whispered under y our breath.

"This is cutting edge tech," Lisa said, with a smile. "It grants access to the building, notes location, accesses your calendar, it's pretty amazing!"

"I'm sure," you told her.

Lisa picked up her phone, and dialed a number, "Wendy? Yeah, I'm done with Jane. Could you come escort her to her new desk? Thanks!"

She hung up the phone. "Wendy will be here in a few minutes. Welcome aboard!"
15311112212112112111112112111.title: Your company ID is a phone app, and she asks to...

153111122121121121111121121111.content:
"...escort HER to HER new desk..." the words echo in your mind.

You couldn't even start to think the best way to handle this situation. Were you legally bound to work here now? Were you really Ray's assistant? A secretary?

You need to take a moment to think this through, you get up from the chair, uncrossing your legs with that slick nylon rubbing sensation, and make it to the door. You open it just in time to see Wendy arrive in front of you.

"Jane," Wendy smiles, "let's go." You walk with her, not even saying goodbye to Lisa. "Now," she says, "I don't know which is your desk, but your EmployeeID app does, can you open it?" While you are starting to regret opening the phone, you follow her instructions, and soon you have a map and big arrows that guide you as you make it to your desk. Sure enough, it's right outside Raymond Teller's corner office. In fact, you've got a clear view of his desk. Fortunately he doesn't seem to be in.

Your desk (your desk?) is neat, clean in a beech style; a big notepad and pen already resting on it. It's a corner cubicle, so it's bigger and more open than the other cubicles. The dividers are at the awkward level of not high enough to offer much privacy, and not low enough to make conversation between workers easy, but talking with your coworking neighbours is the last thing on your mind. You sit down and mechanically check the drawers, finding various stationary supplies and some documents and leaflets giving information about the company, or office procedure or clients. You also find a small makeup compact at the back corner of a drawer. A leftover from the previous owner? "You can just keep that," Wendy says, and you just drop it into your purse.

You sit on the comfy black wheeled office swivel to face the big curved desk. Was this really your desk now? Your high heeled shoes hitting the carpeted floor as you scoot the chair forward gives you no illusion of what you look like, you look like an attractive secretary sitting down at her desk. This was insane, what were you going to do? You look up at Wendy who's smiling back at you. "You're going to fit in perfectly here, I know it." You breath heavier for a second at that comment.

Then you see a guy approach from the next cubicle, sandy hair, wearing his shirt casually. "Hello, I guess you're neighbours." He holds out his hand. You try to smile and shake it, "I'm Rick, you are?"

"This is Jane, Mr. Teller's new assistant," Wendy introduces you.

"Ah, are you?," you nod as he releases his grip. "Well, in that case, make me a coffee." He turns and he sits back down in his cubicle. You turn to Wendy with a look of confusion. She answers.

"Rick does work under Mr. Teller in his department, and helping Mr. Teller means helping his department.... Look, it's best just to do what's needed."

You blink for a few moments taking it all in, then rise again for your desk. Wendy points towards the kitchen and you nod remembering you saw it on the way there. You hesitantly step towards it. It's the first task of your new job, and you're making coffee.
153111122121121121111121121111.title: Your new desk

choices: Raymond?  Here's your cup of coffee
Return to your desk and drink the coffee yourself
1531111221211211211111211211111.content:
You look at your desk, wistfully, then towards the kitchen.

Sighing, you walk into the kitchen and start a pot of coffee. It's one day. It's just one day. Get through it, get out of here, and you're never coming back.

Standing by the coffee maker, tapping your foot, waiting for the pot to brew, you weren't paying attention and didn't hear Raymond come up behind you.

"Looking forward to drinks tonight?" he purred into your ear, causing you to jump. You fell back against the counter, and Raymond was there, right in front of you. more or less forcing you against the counter.

"I know I am," he said with a lecherous grin. "And later, we'll discuss dress codes. My assistant needs to project a certain... image." He leaned in, getting uncomfortably close to your neck, and inhaled. Deeply.

"You smell absolutely wonderful. Oh, and bring me a cup of that coffee you're making." You turned back to the coffee maker and felt a hard slap on your ass. You turned to see Raymond ginning like the Cheshire Cat. You glared at him as he left. The very last thing you wanted was ANY interaction with this guy, regardless of how you were dressed.

Sighing again, you poured two cups of coffee, wanting one for your self, and carried one back to Rick. "Here you go. I hope it's OK." you said.

Rick grinned. "I'm sure it's fine. Thank you." He seemed honestly happy with the cup of coffee.

Now, to deal with the other cup.
1531111221211211211111211211111.title: Making coffee

choices: Raymond holds you back with something else...
You make it to your desk..
15311112212112112111112112111111.content:
You look around for Wendy, maybe she could give you support, but she's gone.

Sighing, you look towards Ray's office and see him desk through the glass walls.. He's looking straight at you, smiling. Unnerved, part of you wants to fly down the steps but part of you gets worried he'll follow, so instead you put on an unsure smile and enter his office.

"Your coffee?" you say.

"Ah yes, put it here," he points to the edge of the desk that's closest to him. It's a big desk, and in order to put the coffee where he pointed, you have to stand right in front of his desk and lean forward. Only mid way through doing this do you suddenly realise the view you're giving him. His smile is bigger now, and you quickly lean back.

"Yes," he continues, "we must definitely work on your outfit. Could I have your phone number?"

"Ummmm...." you hesitate.

"Oh yes, silly me, it should be on the system." He takes out his phone. "I don't know why people say EmployeeID is confusing, it gives you everything you need if you just know what buttons to press. Here we go." You suddenly hear a familiar chime from outside the office, looking in that direction, you can see your purse under your desk where you left it. "Ah," said Ray, following your gaze, "glad that works. I'll text you the dress code before tomorrow. Don't worry about cost, I'll assign an expense account to your app. Did you know the app can make purchases too? In real shops? Technology moves so fast and I love every minute of it."

You stand there, nodding in a way you hope is polite.

"What about you? Do you like technology."

You think back to everything that's happened in the last too days. "Well, when it does what you want it to do."

"Ah yes, many people have that problem." Ray stood up and moved in front of his desk, "I find to get what you want, you just have to learn to ask for it in the right way." He's right in front of you now. "7 O'Clock, Breech's, on Moore St. Will you be there? Or if you can't wait, we can have one right now." He subtly nodded towards the cabinet.

"No," you reply.

"Waiting it is," he smiled, "in the meantime, take a look." He takes you by the shoulders and suddenly turns you towards the side. You now face a row of floor to ceiling windows that give a massive, view of the city from many stories up.

"Wow," you reply genuinely impressed, stepping towards the window and looking out. It takes a while to take in the view, see all the details and buildings, get a sense of where everything is.

"Impressive isn't it, if you look in the distance you can see some of the forests and sawmills that actually make what we sell. The offices used to be over there before we moved to a more central place", you quint your eyes, trying to make out the detail. For all the crazy stuff that was going on, at least you got something nice out of it.

"It's a great view," you say.

"It sure is." Something in the way he said it made you turn, Ray had sat down in a comfortable low chair and was looking at your lower regions. How long had he been doing that since you turned your back.

Dammit, with this guy if it isn't one thing or another....

"I should really get back to my desk," you say.
15311112212112112111112112111111.title: Raymond?  Here's your cup of coffee

choices: Date outfit arrives. Raymond wants to see you model it.
153111122121121121111121121111112.content:
Flustered, you simply said, "Uh... I should get back to my desk."

Raymond smiled. "On the one hand, I don't want you to leave. On the other, I'll enjoy watching you leave."

You stared at him for a second before you turned and slowly walked back towards your desk. But as you were slowly walking away, you realized two things. The first was that walking slowly gave Raymond more time to leer, possibly thinking that you were showing off for him. The second was that slowly walking in those damn heels made your rear sway, also probably enticing Raymond.

You gave up and just scurried back to your desk. You sat down, and slumped over, your newly long hair falling about your face. You heard the "ping" from your phone, followed by EDNA's voice. "Expense account activated. Date clothing ordered. Will be delivered to you shortly, Jane. Was there anything else I could do for you?"

You grabbed the phone and stared at it. If EDNA was a person, you'd have your hands around her? Yes, EDNA was a her... throat.

"Getting started already?" Raymond said, leaning against the doorway of his office, arms folded across his chest, grinning at you. "You do realize that I see and have to approve all your purchases, right? You're going to look hot in that dress. And those heels....". He did the "French chef finger kiss" thing. "Exquisite."

You wanted to crawl into a hole.
153111122121121121111121121111112.title: You make it to your desk..

1531111221211211211111211211111122.content:
You've got to get out of this, away from... him. You busy yourself with the desk, try to look distracted with work, but you realise you have no work to be distracted by and can feel he's still looking at you.

You turn to face him. "Is there anything you want me to... do? Any assignments you want me to run, places to go?" You almost plead the last words out, but hold back to make it sounds like you're just being helpful.

"Nope, you can just keep your pretty ass here. And I mean it, it is a fine ass!"

Will this guy not stop? "Are you sure? Nothing you need delivered or anything?" You grin probably a bit more than normal.

Raymond frowns for a second, "Just a moment."

He goes back into his office. With glances over his shoulder you can see him reading documents with his brow furrowed or concentrating on his computer. It occurs to you that he's working; as in, he's actually doing his job.

You look forward again and hear a chime. You look on your phone and see it somehow has already been receiving your work emails. One from HR welcoming you aboard and giving you employee information, one from Frank Earnest (you gulp) but it seems to be a form letter given to every new employee that welcomes them and explains the company's values, a slew of EmployeeID emails for various activities including one saying the expense account was activated.

You start as a hand lands on your shoulder. Looking up you see Raymond again, still smiling but with a slightly more serious expression on his face.

"So," he starts, "can you be diplomatic?" You force a smile, it seems to have been the right answer.

"I need some sales documents delivered to a company called Bernard Woodworking who are on the other side of the city. Normally we'd courier them over but you see... well... are you good at business politics?" You nod, again the right answer. He puts a big binder of paper on the desk in front of you and continues.

"They've been clients of us for years, really helpful in our earlier years, but the truth is we've been neglecting them recently. We're chasing big clients at the moment, trying to aggressively expand, and honestly haven’t given Bernard Woodworking the attention it normally gets. What's worse, they're noticing it, probably not enough to drop us but enough that we need to make sure it doesn't happen. So: I need you to go over there, give these documents, directly to Bernard himself. Say you're my direct assistant and you're delivering these because I wanted to ensure they were delivered with the utmost personal care and attention. Say I profusely apologise for past delays and things have just been busy. Don't say you've only started working with me today. Show we really care for them, show they have our full attention and... just really smile and turn on the charm. Make him feel like he's a really cared for and valuable client. I know he'll appreciate it. I've a feeling you've got a real knack for client care."

You look up dubiously, but gradually realise that it's a chance to get out of the office and away from him, maybe even escape. "Okay," you say, "I'll make sure these get to him." Was it your imagination or was your voice sounding a bit different, lighter? Your throat had been through a bit...

You reach for the documents.

"The address is on the business card on the front, though I'll message you the map location so you don't get the wrong location. One other thing, while the documents aren’t vital, they're still important legal documents. If anything happens to them contact the legal team, or better yet don't let anything happen to them. We had this courier a while back who... oh, nevermind. Just don't incur the wrath of the legal department!" He finishes with a low laugh.

You strain a smile as find yourself instinctively putting your purse back on. You bow to pick up the documents. You realise this gave Ray another view. You turn towards him, smile again, and backstep away before realising you really can't pull that off in heels. So you turn around and walk forward, hips swaying with the heels and document weight. You try to pretend he isn't looking as you focus on the elevator.

"Not going to say goodbye?"

You pause, look over your shoulder at that grin shining back at you. "Let's say, 'See you later'" He chuckles in response. Did your comment come across as flirty? You put that out of your mind and walk on.
1531111221211211211111211211111122.title: Raymond gives you an assignment

15311112212112112111112112111111222.content:
You heard your phone chime again, and you fished it out of your purse. It had a map of exactly where to go. And... EmployeeID showed your location on the map. Now THAT was a little big brother-y. Apparently during work hours they tracked where you were.

Sighing, you walked out of the security doors, through the lobby, and out into the street. You walked over to a trash can and held the folder over it, thinking that you were now out of the building and could go see about getting EDNA to straighten things out. But you stopped.

You bit your lip. If you didn’t deliver this, it could impact the company, possibly jeopardizing a lot of people’s jobs.

Stomping a heeled foot, you realized you pretty much HAD to deliver these documents. And suck up to Bernard a bit. And THEN you could go home and get out of this getup.

Hoisting your purse back up onto a proper position, you hailed a cab. It didn’t take long for one to stop, so you got in, gave the driver the destination, and sat back. You popped another lozenge in your mouth as you mentally urged the driver to get across town as fast as possible. Your day in drag was just about over. Drop these files off, schmooze a bit, and then you were free.
15311112212112112111112112111111222.title: Try to deliver the documents

153111122121121121111121121111112221.content:
Traffic was beginning to get thick (lunch hour?) but thankfully the taxi driver was able to slip through the worst of it. Your mental urgings seem to have worked.

"Got business to attend to?" the driver casually asked.

"Just someone I need to see." Fortunately the conversation didn't continue much beyond there.

When he dropped you off, you found yourself in an industrial estate. Around you were large buildings, you saw a drapery place nearby with the windows full of fabric, a piano company, and many buildings with the name of multiple companies on signs outside of them. You entered a plain 3 story building with a Bernard Woodworking sign on it and found yourself in a plain but neat reception area with the narrow stairs plainly visible. Through a door you could see what looked like a workshop, with the occasional sounds of hammer and saws. You focus your attention towards the elderly bespectacled woman at reception. "I'm hear to see Bernard? I believe he's expecting me." Your voice really did seem softer and more soothing somehow.

"Yes, he's expecting you." She directs you up the stairs (no elevators), and you try to navigate them with the awkward heels, hunched over to with documents still in hand. You navigate a narrow corridor of office doors, before finding one labelled "Bernard Woodrow", you knock and enter a modestly sized office.

A blond haired, youngish, energetic man looks up expectantly. After waiting for him to start, you take the initiative.

"Hello, my name is Jane Johnson. I'm here on behalf of Raymond Teller from Ernest Lumber. He asked me to personally deliver these documents." You mince forward, with an awkward flashback to doing the same thing to Raymond earlier that day.

"Yes, he mentioned." Bearnard says simply. You drop the documents neatly on his desk and look back at Bernard. He wasn't hugely moved one way or another. You really don't have to do anything more than that, you could leave now, but with everything Ray said, you feel you have to make a minimum effort to "schmooze" the client.
153111122121121121111121121111112221.title: Arriving to meet with Bernard

choices: a slinky formal gown, complete with tiara
1531111221211211211111211211111122211.content:
"Um... Raymond wanted me to convey his apologies for not being as... responsive as we.... he... the company, I mean, could have been." You stopped and smiled at Bernard, hoping he'd say something.

Bernard just... stared back at you. He tilted his head slightly as if listening to a high pitched sound. He sat back in his chair, picked up the receiver on his phone, and dialed a number.

"Raymond sent someone. She's not right," he muttered into the phone.

Uh oh. Was he onto you?

"No.... No.... She's not right!" he repeated, more emphatically. He then looked directly at you, his eyes working up and down your body. "Yes, that would be acceptable."

Bernard hung up the phone.

"Um... Bernard.... Mr. Woodrow?" you asked.

"Shhhhh!" Bernard said, putting a finger to his lips as he did. "Not yet. You're not right."

OK, that was weird. This whole thing was weird.

"Maybe I should go," you said. Turning, you started to the door.

It opened, and the older receptionist was standing with her hand out, as if she had just been about to open the door.

Bernard stood, placing both hands on his desk and leaned forward. "Dorothy, she's NOT RIGHT!"

"Yes, yes, Bernard," the woman, apparently Dorothy, said. "Don't worry. I'll make her right."

Things had just taken a hard left from weird onto completely messed up.

"If you'll come with me, dear," Dorothy said, a sad smile on her face.

"You minced after her, your feet beginning to hurt in the heels after being on them so much. "What's going on?"

Dorothy sighed. "Bernard is a gifted businessman. His instincts have taken his father's business and allowed it to blossom," she said as she gestured for you to walk down the hallway with her. "Unfortunately, he has his demons, and I try to overcome them to allow him to focus on the business."

"OK," you said. "But what on earth did he mean by my 'not being right'?"

Dorothy again gave you that sad, warm smile. "Raymond has been assisting Bernard for years now. And when he sends over a pretty girl like you, well, they're dressed more to... Bernard's tastes... to make him happy, you understand."

"Wait...Raymond sends girls here..." you started to ask.

"...and to get Bernard to listen, they have to be presented appropriately." Dorothy finished. "It's just clothes, dear. You'll be fine. Let's get you properly attired so that you can finish what you came here for."

You ground your teeth. Raymond had pretty much set you up with doing this, but because the company could suffer if you didn't, you pretty much had no choice but to put on whatever Bernard needed.

You closed your eyes and opened your clenched fists, taking several deep breaths before following Dorothy again. She opened a door, flicking on a light switch, and motioned for you to enter. "You can change in here, honey," she said.

You walked into the room, which was apparently an unused office. "If you'll give me just a few moments," Dorothy said, looking you up and down. "I think we have something in your size. I'll be right back."

You sat on the unused desk in the room, crossed your leg, and kicked your foot for several minutes, waiting for Dorothy's return, fuming all the while. There was a knock on the door, it opened, and Dorothy peered through the crack. "Here, Jane. Put this on, and we'll go back to Bernard."

She handed you a bundle of clothing..
1531111221211211211111211211111122211.title: You make an effort

15311112212112112111112112111111222111.content:
You sorted through the pile of clothing Dorothy had handed you. It was a slinky, tight ballgown, some sky high heels that matched, and a tiara. Seriously, a tiara?

You held the gown in your hand, raised your arm back to slam it into the ground and thought, again, that the company needed this business, that if you didn't help out, people could lose their jobs...

"EDNA!" you grumbled through clenched teeth.

You sighed, heavily. In for a penny, in for a pound, right?

You carefully undid your work outfit, finally getting to see the lingerie that EDNA had apparently stuffed you into, and stepped into the gown. It was an off the shoulder number, in deep, rich red satin. You reached behind you to zip it up, but couldn't quite reach it to get it fully closed.

After struggling for several long seconds, a soft knock came at the door. "Honey? Need any help?" Dorothy asked softly.

Grumbling, you hoisted up the tight skirt, walked in your stocking feet over to the door and opened it. "Can you... zip me up, please?" you asked, turning around.

Dorothy did just that. She then held the heels and you wriggled your feet into them. "Sorry, dear, they're a bit small for you. But it's just temporary." She gave a weak smile, apparently knowing what was being asked of you.

She then placed the tiara onto your head, the combs in it biting into your hair and scalp. She smoothed the skirt around your hips. "Perfect. He'll love you. Raymond sends over the prettiest girls for Bernard. You'll be one of his favorites."

That... did not sound good.

"Now, let's get you to Bernard. He's anxiously waiting for you. You can leave your things here. They'll be safe."

Dorothy held the door open for you. Taking mincing steps due to the heels and the gown, you wiggled your way back down the hall to Bernard's office.
15311112212112112111112112111111222111.title: a slinky formal gown, complete with tiara

153111122121121121111121121111112221112.content:
It was like your legs were restrained, and the heels weren’t much better, but you gradually got into the rhythm of the short steps. Stopping at Bernard's office door, you lean over, open it wide in front of you, and mice back in.

The moment Bernard sees you, a broad smile comes across its face. He exudes a sense of relief, like the worries of the world slip from his shoulders. Despite everything, you're surprised that you could suddenly have that effect on someone.

"You came... for me?" he asks in an almost sentimental way.

Actually I came because a demented computer and a lewd unwanted boss forced me into this, you think. Instead you simply nod.

"It's been so long," he looks into the distance, like his mind is a million miles away, then suddenly he looks back at you. "Let's make up for lost time."

He stands up from behind his desk and walk around to you. You're momentarily taken aback as he approaches, but hold firm, figuring enough people know about this guy that he's not going to do anything dangerous.

There's an old style stereo on a side table, he presses a button on it, and suddenly luxurious ballroom music comes out.

Your stomach sinks as your head figures out what's next.

You're right.

Grasping your left hand in his right and pushing it out to the side, putting his left hand behind your back in an tight embrace that you replicate to keep standing up; you dance.

You wobble uncertainly, as he makes bold moves, practically pulling you around barely noticing your resistance. Pressed against him, you have no idea how to to react and just about have enough or your mind together to go along with it.

A dingy office with you in a ballgown while being serenaded by a crazy businessman you just met. You can barely keep up with all the weird stuff that is happening.

The music's tempo increases and he pulls you around in faster motions. Your feet stumble, so he holds you tighter, until he's practically lifting you off the ground and swinging you around. And then he dips you. You lean back so far, he's practically over you, you look up at him and he looks right back into your eyes, the position is held for a moment more, then he pulls you back up and the ballroom steps continue.

You're pleading for this to be over, but the music continues. You desperately focus on your footwook trying to get a bit more stable, but the heels, skirt and dancing all unite to thwart you. You're helpless but to go along with his moves.
153111122121121121111121121111112221112.title: Bernard wants to dance

1531111221211211211111211211111122211121.content:
As the music changes so do the dance moves, they become more elaborate(harder whither you prefer) yet you notice that you are now keeping up unlike a few seconds ago. As you try to figure out If this guy was up to something given how he greeted you when you returned in this outfit, another question hits you like a runaway train.

How you get better at dancing in heels in a span of a few seconds?

They only answer you can come up with is, your being hypnotized but is it programming
1531111221211211211111211211111122211121.title: The music changes

choices: Your date clothes had been delivered.
1531111221211211211111211211111122211122.content:
After what seemed liked forever, the music swelled, Bernard dropping you into another dip, his face inches from yours. You were bent back into a perilous position, not quite able to stand up, but if Bernard let go, you were going down.

He spun you up, again the heels making you feel on the edge of teetering, and the music reached a crescendo. With a climax, the music stopped, Bernard bent way over in a deep bow, his arm raised above his back, holding your arm up in the air.

He stood, clapping, and hugged you. You just wanted to run.

“Oh!” Bernard said, excitedly, “Raymond outdid himself with you! You’re my new favorite!”

That couldn’t be good. “Um, favorite?” You asked him.

Smiling broadly, he nodded. “I’m going to ask for you always!” A frown crossed his face. “You’ll bed to dance better, though.” He brightened again, “But still very nice for a beginner!”

He walked back over to his desk and sat down behind it. You minced over to the chair in front of the desk and slid into it. The tightness of the gown and the heels only allowed you to perch on the edge of it with your knees bent and off to the side. “Mr Woodrow... Raymond sent me over here to deliver these documents...”

Bernard waved a hand. “Tell Raymond not to worry. And that I expect to see much more of you. I’ll dash him off an email right now, telling him to sign you up for ballroom dance lessons, too!”

“Mr. Woodrow, that’s/ hardly...”

“I know, my dear. You don’t have to thank me.” He tapped off a quick email. “There. And I expect to see you here again....” he consulted an appointment book, “...next Wednesday, 1 PM sharp.

“I’ll have my lawyers look at the papers you brought, but I’m sure we’ll have these back to you in just a few days.”

Bernard picked up his phone and pushed a button on it. “Yes, Dorothy. She’s ready.”

Turning back to you, he said, “Thank you! See you next Wednesday!”

Dorothy then entered, and you stood and minced over to her. After leaving the office and closing the door behind her, she whispered, “How did it go?”

“OK?” You answered, uncertainly.

Dorothy winked at you. “He likes you. I can tell.”

“He wants me to come back.”

“Wonderful, dear! You must have made a good impression!”

She led you back to the unused office. You entered and looked around for your clothes you left there. Panicking, you asked Dorothy, “Where’d my clothes go?”
1531111221211211211111211211111122211122.title: Eventually, the music stops

choices: You get to the car waiting outside
Striper heels and old office stairs do not go well together
1531111221211211211111211211111122211122.content:
"Oh, we returned your clothes."

"Returned?" you say with a heightened edge to your voice. Are they gone? Do you have to spend the rest of the day in a ballroom gown?

"Oh don't worry, your new clothes arrived."

"Sorry?"

"You... had a clothes delivery didn't you?" A sinking feeling hits you, but you let her continue. "They delivered clothes saying it was for you, and offered to bring back the clothes you were wearing to your house, you know, so you weren't carrying around a second set of clothes all day. Was that okay?"

You pause, forcing yourself to remain calm and find out exactly what is going on: "The clothes they delivered.... can I see them?"

"Oh, I put them in here!" and she opened a big cabinet.

You look in dismay and some panic. Some clear shoes that had poles for heels and a big platform under their front sole, elevating feet to a whole new level. You had worn two pairs of high heels already today and these looked the least stable. Beside the shoes was a pool of silver sparkling fabric that you weren’t sure you wanted to touch yet. The last item was a compact silver clutch purse. "I moved everything from your other purse to this one, so you wouldn't be carrying two purses around," Dorothy says.

The purse contents are the last things on your mind, you need to get out of here wearing something and your options are a ballroom gown or a spandex dress.

You're just about to ask Dorothy if she has anything else when suddenly it hits you: You don't need to worry. You're planning to head straight home anyway. Okay so maybe they know your address and phone number, but nothing needs to force you to do another thing today that you don't want to do.

Courage returns to you. You smile at Dorothy, thank her and tell her she's done a great job but that you need to change. Thankfully, she suggestes pulling the zip down before she leaves which makes it much easier getting the dress off.

Standing in your undergarments, you look at the date clothing and gulp. The spandex dress seems to flow from your hands as you pick it up. Figuring out which way is "up", you pull it over your head and down onto you. It clings to you with its elasticity that covers every curve, and barely covers down your thighs, but thankfully, it covers you up to your neckline and right down your arms to your wrists. You can't believe that this is what you now consider to be "could be worse"

The shoes are next, and you have to practically climb up onto them. Putting them on tilts you precariously forward that you have to lean back to counter. The arch your back makes as you balance emphasises your chest as it sticks out. You know you can never let Raymond see you like this. You just need to get on a taxi home and forget about everything. You clothes should be enough to let you do that at least

Right, you think, a taxi. You bend over to reach for the purse and pick it up. As you look up you catch a reflection of yourself in the window. An attractive women in a tight silver dress in heels that seemed to scream "lets have some fun", ready for a night out. You start breathing sharply, you needed to get out.

While loath to do so, you open your purse and take out the accursed phone. It has some notifications, such as one saying the clothes have been delivered (thanks!), a reminder for your 7pm date, and some other "work" stuff you don't have time for right now (or ever).

You try to figure out which app will get you a taxi or rideshare or whatever, but getting exhausted you just say "EDNA: I need a ride home." A few minutes later, your phone tells you that your ride as arrived. Breathing with relief and ready to put this whole thing behind you, you walk out the door and down the corridor.
1531111221211211211111211211111122211122.title: Your date clothes had been delivered.

choices: The driver didn't notice the rerouting
You tell the driver there's a mistake and you need to go home.
1531111221211211211111211211111122211122.content:
You struggled as you walked out. The heels made you take very small steps. The stupid dress was VERY short, and you had to keep tugging it down. Dorothy escorted you out, and said, "We'll see you next week, honey!"

You teetered, slowly and unsteadily, out to the car. You opened the door, sat, swung your legs in, and hoped the driver, who was watching you intently in the mirror, hadn't been flashed.

You stopped and thought about that for a second. You shuddered, as you weren't sure which was worse, worrying about flashing your panties to some strange guy or that you were worried about flashing your panties in the first place.

The driver looked in the rear mirror and grinned. "Hot date?" he asked?

"Nope. Going home. This has all been one big mistake."

"Got it," the driver said, grinning.

You pulled out from Bernard's and go on the road. You heard a chime from your small purse. You tried to ignore it, but, given how this day had gone, you gave in after several seconds and pulled the phone out of the small silver clutch.

You blinked. The EmployeeID showed you on the road, heading back to the office. And Raymond had just sent an email, asking you how it went and that you'd go over things when you returned to the office.

You started mashing buttons on the phone, trying to figure out how to urn it off when the chime went off again. You heart sank when you saw the notice pop up from EDNA:

"Presence requested back at work, Jane. Ride home cancelled. Returning you to work."

Before you could say anything, the drivers GPS *pinged* and the route was recalculated, rerouting you back to... Work. And Raymond.

You swallowed hard.
1531111221211211211111211211111122211122.title: You get to the car waiting outside

choices: EDNA takes action while you're asleep
You wake up to hear someone at the door
1531111221211211211111211211111122211122.content:
"Excuse me, sir?" you don't know why you're being so timid. This is your own ride, you should be able to tell it where to go. "I think there's a mistake with the GPS."

"Oh, I barely use it, you said you were going home?"

"Yes but..."

The driver glances at the GPS "Oh, I see what you mean. So you wanted to go to your first destination? Meadow Drive?"

"Yes, that would be.... I would really like that."

"Okay. Just ignore the GPS, we'll head there now."

You sat back in relief, but a bit of nervousness entered your body. With notifications and EDNA and phones that tracked you, it was all giving you a general sense of unease.

Your unease seemed unwarranted as the taxi pulled up outside your house. Thanking the taxi driver, you stumble as you get out, and make the remaining walk to your front door like you're on stilts. The house keys are in your purse, and like that, you're inside.

"Jane, you are not at work."

You don't say anything. If you don't say anything, then EDNA can't use it against you.

"You have an appointment at work." You just stumble in the hallway, leaving the purse on the hallway table. "Failure to show up for work can result in lost financial earnings and lowered social colleague esteem." You can't believe that something that talks like that has thrown such a cramp on your life. "Are you sick, shall I notify medical authorities."

"No," you risk.

"Would you like something to eat?"

You pause, you don't know how long its been since... in fact, did you eat at all today? You've been feeling a lot of weird things today, was one of them simple old fashioned hunger? "You know, I would like something to eat."

"Understood, please make your way to the kitchen."

You look briefly at your getup, then sighing, take off the heels at least, dump them in the hallway, and walk barefoot into the kitchen.

There are some hummings and machine noise as you sit down at a raised "bar" on the kitchen. Then robotic arms come out lowering fresh food right down in front of you, complete with water and cuttlery. There's natural yoghurt with blueberries, fresh melon and pineapple, and some chicken in a caesar salad. A full afternoon meal just like that.

"Very nice!" you say.

"EDNA aims to please and support all aspects of your life" is the reply.

You smile wryly. Once you get it to stop thinking you're a girl there may actually be a lot of good things this machine could do.

For the moment you devour your meal and are glad it filled you up. It's like you were running on panic and adrenalin the whole day. Now that you've got some food into you, you suddenly feel sleepy.

You couch of the front living room isn't far away and you decide to sit back on it. Lazily you reach for the remote but can't find one. Having a thought you say, "EDNA, turn on the TV", and like that the TV turns on.

Yes, you really needed to sort this house out.... a bit of tweaking here... a bit there... and it would be ideal.... to.....zzzzzzzzzzzzzz.
